meanings.definition: The jaw or jawbone, especially the lower jawbone in vertebrates.
meanings.sent1: The lion used its powerful mandibles to crush the bones of its prey.
meanings.sent2: The dentist examined the patient's mandibles to check for any abnormalities.
meanings.sent3: The mandibles of the alligator were so strong, they could break through tough shells easily.
meanings.sent4: Her anger was like the sharp mandibles of a trap, ready to snap shut at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The image of the mandibles chomping down on the food was etched in his memory.

meanings.definition: Either half of the crushing organ in an arthropod's mouthparts.
meanings.sent1: The ant used its mandibles to carry the tiny leaf back to its nest.
meanings.sent2: The beetle's mandibles were sharp and efficient in breaking down the decaying wood.
meanings.sent3: The praying mantis waved its mandibles in a comical dance to scare off predators.
meanings.sent4: The crab's mandibles worked tirelessly to crack open the shellfish for its meal.
meanings.sent5: The mandibles of the spider moved with precision as it spun its intricate web.
